reviewText: This documentary is probably one of the most valuable sources of information I can pass on to my HBCU students. It makes the truth plain and reveals what Eurocentrists are still trying to suppress, distort, steal and deny. I wish I could give about 200 copies to my friends and students.As Nas states in one of his songs,"They say we N-I double G-E-R, we areMuch more, still we choose to ignoreThe obvious, man this history don't acknowledge usWe were scholars long before colleges"This documentary acknowledges the extraordinary history of Africans and the impact that they have had all over the world. You can't hide the truth forever: it comes shining through.
Title: Hidden Colors: The Untold History Of People Of Aboriginal,Moor,and African Descent

reviewText: The knowledge and courage to produce this DVD is commendable.  Much of the information I am familiar with.  However the validation is greatly valued.Additionally, the value of my daughter seeing that there are other Afrikan people who have an understanding of The Terrorism of The Delusion of White Supremacy is priceless.She now more clearly sees that: my mother is not just a disgruntled African born in Amerikkka.She has a deeper understanding that the greatest lie ever told is western civilization and that the context of non-white peoples' lives needs to be understood in the context of being terrorized in all domains of people activity by those who categorize themselves as white.
summary: An opportunity for Afrikan people internationally to come to understand what terrorism really is
Title: Hidden Colors: The Untold History Of People Of Aboriginal,Moor,and African Descent

reviewText: I already knew some of the material presented in this documentary. Sad to say, there are still people who refuse to see the truth about ancient African history. Had Africans never been enslaved, we would have progressed even further than what our world has right now. Congrats to Tariq Nasheed for not being afraid to let the truth come out.
summary: Bravo To Such An Excellent Documentary!
Title: Hidden Colors: The Untold History Of People Of Aboriginal,Moor,and African Descent

reviewText: Fabulous record of historical accounts solid facts. The only compliment to this documentary is its sequel, Hidden Colors 2: The Triumph of Melanin. These two documentaries need to be seen by every black, brown, yellow, pink, red, peach, tanned, and white person who identifies with a minority group. It also needs to be seen by any group considered a dominant or majority. If you are looking for lies and subjugation, don't view this documentary or its sister because you will be highly disappointed that you would have to accept what you may have chosen to ignore. The seller is on point with delivery, so order these if available and be prepared to be awed.
summary: Hidden Colors: The Untold History of People of Aboriginal, Moor, and African Descent
Title: Hidden Colors: The Untold History Of People Of Aboriginal,Moor,and African Descent

reviewText: Hidden Colors: The Untold History of People of Aboriginal, Moor and African American HeritageAlso enjoyed Hidden Colors 2 and looking forward to Hidden Colors 3. This film is highly recommended to educators who teach African American History.
summary: Hidden Colors is highly recommended to African American History Educators.

reviewText: While I am sure it is flawed on some levels, I found Hidden Colors as a whole a very great experience. As for the actual creator Tariq Nasheed, I realize he's viewed as a pig, a misygynist  and other terms but that wasn't my concern on this one. My concern was the information and presentation of this DVD and I was pleased for the most part.While I don't agree with everything Mr. Nasheed says or does or how he conducts himself at times, I am behind this project and will buy HC2 and HC3 (when its released)! Good documentary!
summary: Good look at lost African history
Title: Hidden Colors: The Untold History Of People Of Aboriginal,Moor,and African Descent

reviewText: No African Americans can not rely on the public educational system to teach them their stolen history. This presentation asks for you to go look up and research soo many things. A lot of ground is being covered here none of the claims seem to fantastic for the worlds oldest race and the origin of the human. Our education of self starts as animals and then we wonder how hatred creeps into the hearts of children who were formerly innocent of race hatred and had multiracial friends. To imagine that there is more to the people that we see today before 1776. To use 1776 as a reference to the AA is another mental slight. Christianity was the rape apparatus of the African peoples.
summary: Very Sober, Very Brave, Not to Guilty of Romanticism, More Scholarly

reviewText: This was an all out assault on the carefully crafted indoctrination center we call "public education".  I was so energized after watching this DVD i wanted to hold a rally and gather all my sisters and brothers and share this powerful information with them.  The institution of misinformation, lies blatant and by omission was exposed for what it has accomplished thus far in this country.  I want to thank everyone that was involved in this magnificent project and I will be sharing this with my family and friends. We can still love our heritage without trouncing that of others...too bad the "powers" that be dont practice that.
Title: Hidden Colors: The Untold History Of People Of Aboriginal,Moor,and African Descent

Title: Hidden Colors: The Untold History Of People Of Aboriginal,Moor,and African Descent

reviewText: After viewing this dvd, I will never look at baggy pants, classical music and cavemen in the same way!  I found the passionate commentary, by people who have given their lives to studying the African contribution to humanity, both enlightening and entertaining. I learned facts about history, mathmatics, economics, education, music, language and politics. I particularly enjoyed the artifacts that showed the presence of black-skinned African people in parts of the world that were never mentioned in school.  This is good ammunition when negative comments are made about black and brown people.  I bought this as a Black History Month present to myself and it was money well spent.  I am definitely going to share this with friends and family!
summary: Entertaining Documentary With Unknown Yet Uplifting Facts!
Title: Hidden Colors: The Untold History Of People Of Aboriginal,Moor,and African Descent

reviewText: I think this is a must see for anyone really interested in history. It's a double must see for anyone of color especially a person who self-identifies as "African descent". I'm aware of a couple of the presenters so what they had to say is not a surprise for me. It's a good teaching tool but not for anyone who believes in the "Bell Curve" theory! then again...maybe even they might learn something different.

reviewText: There is no doubt that Africans have been treated badly by Europeans, Americans and others in the past and today, but it would help you make your case if you presented scientific evidence that we are all Africans. The evidence is there.I would like to mention two sources that use undisputed DNA evidence that every human alive today has an ancestor who left East Africa to populate every continent in the world. The first source is Dr. Spencer Wells, who released a DVD in 2003 titled "Journey of Man", proving that the first humans were Namibian Bushmen. He even traced the routes they followed based on mutations in paternal DNA. This DVD is available on Amazon.The second source is a book titled "The Seven Daughters of Eve" by Bryan Sykes,who is a professor of genetics at Oxford University. The book was published in 2001. He found that all humans alive today are related to seven women who left Africa 150,000 years ago. He used mitochondrial DNA as proof. I bought this book on Amazon.What this means is that we are all Africans. Our ancestors lost their melanin when they arrived in cold countries.The Olmec face that you saw in Mexico could have been African. There are many black faces in Mexico and the Caribbean. To see other similar stone faces, go to the museum in the city of Villahermosa, Mexico, in the state of Chiapas. I have seen them.We are all Africans. There are many other scientific sources that prove that. DNA doesn't lie.
summary: Some Sources That Prove Your Case
Title: Hidden Colors: The Untold History Of People Of Aboriginal,Moor,and African Descent
